main event: Witnesses reported observing a bright light in the sky near Minneapolis, Minnesota, on 8 September 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as being much brighter than any star and changing colors from white to yellow to red., The witnesses stated that the object appeared round or oval, with an estimated altitude of 1500 to 2000 feet., During the sighting, the witnesses experienced malfunctions with their automobile engine and radio which resumed normal operation after the object disappeared., The investigation revealed no conventional aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting., The incident was part of an ongoing investigation by the USAF's Project Blue Book.
sighted object: a bright light that changed colors and appeared to be moving rapidly
witness description: Robert Olson and Robert Dean, employed by the University of Minnesota
